title: Firefox profile
content:
Hi,

I was super pumped about profiles but it seems it has gone terribly wrong for me.

I created a two profiles on one computer and would like to reuse them on another. Apparently this is impossible, which is really too bad, please change that! Why would I want to redo everything on every computer that I work with? And it deleted bookmarks on other computers synched to my account, why?

And I deleted every profile on one of my computers, in the hopes to "start fresh" since I had lost all my work, and now Firefox refuses to open. It indicates "Your Firefox profile cannot be loaded. It may be missing or inaccessible".

So now I need to re-install the whole app. Just... Why?

Thanks!

title: How Can I Quickly Search Real Estate Listings Using Firefox?
content:
Hi everyone,

I usually use Firefox for browsing, but I’m finding it a bit tricky to search for real estate listings efficiently. Some websites don’t load properly, and filtering options sometimes don’t work as expected.

Does anyone know the best way to optimize Firefox for smooth browsing and searching on property websites? Are there settings, extensions, or tips that make filtering and navigating listings easier?

I recently started using Saakin (https://www.saakin.qa/) to explore apartments for rent in Doha and other properties in Qatar, and it works pretty well. Any advice on improving my Firefox experience with sites like this would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks!

title: How Can I Fix Rendering Issues on Firefox for My Website?
content:
Hi everyone,

I run AHS Rankers (https://ahsrankers.com/), a site that lists and ranks auto repair shops, and I’ve noticed that some pages don’t render correctly in Firefox. Elements like tables, images, and menus sometimes appear misaligned, even though the site works fine in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve tried:

  • Clearing caches and cookies
  • Updating CSS for responsive design
  • Testing in Firefox Developer Edition

Despite this, the layout still breaks on certain pages. I’m looking for guidance on:

  • Firefox-specific CSS or HTML quirks to watch out for
  • Debugging tools within Firefox for layout issues
  • Best practices for ensuring cross-browser compatibility

Has anyone else experienced layout problems on Firefox, especially with content-heavy or interactive pages? Any tips, resources, or solutions would be much appreciated!

Thanks in advance!
creator: ahsrankers

title: How Can I Fix Rendering Issues on Firefox for My Website?
content:
Hi everyone,

I run AHS Rankers (https://ahsrankers.com/), a site that lists and ranks auto repair shops, and I’ve noticed that some pages don’t render correctly in Firefox. Elements like tables, images, and menus sometimes appear misaligned, even though the site works fine in Chrome and Edge.

I’ve tried:

  • Clearing caches and cookies
  • Updating CSS for responsive design

Despite this, the layout still breaks on certain pages. I’m looking for guidance on:

  • Firefox-specific CSS or HTML quirks to watch out for
  • Debugging tools within Firefox for layout issues
  • Best practices for ensuring cross-browser compatibility

Has anyone else experienced layout problems on Firefox, especially with content-heavy or interactive pages? Any tips, resources, or solutions would be much appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

title: "Always ask you where to save files" is definitely broken. Can we please open a bug report for it?
content:
This setting, "Always ask you where to save files," is definitely broken.

In a related article, they provided this solution: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1534384 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1534384]

Proposed solution: "I believe you also need to go into Tools -> Settings -> General and set the Action for the types of downloads (Applications) to Always Ask for those types you want it to."

But this workaround should not be needed. "Always ask" means always ask. As in always. No other additional steps should be needed.

Can you folks please open a bug to get this fixed? This used to work just fine in (much) older versions of Firefox and Netscape. "Always ask" is supposed to mean always ask. Like, always.
creator: rulalala

title: MetaMask Add-on Performance Issue on Mozilla Firefox
content:
The MetaMask browser extension is extremely slow and unresponsive when used in Mozilla Firefox. Actions such as opening the wallet, switching networks, approving transactions, or interacting with dApps take a long time or freeze temporarily.

This issue occurs only in Firefox. MetaMask works smoothly and as expected on other browsers (for example, Chromium-based browsers) and all other websites and browser extensions load and function normally in Firefox. This suggests the problem is specific to the MetaMask add-on behavior within Firefox rather than general browser performance.

Impact:

Delayed transaction approvals

Lag while opening the extension

Poor user experience when interacting with dApps

Productivity impact when using Web3 applications
